summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 22, 2020, between FBI personnel discussing the imminent arrest and charging of Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the planned charges, her suspected location in Massachusetts, and coordination for the arrest and subsequent investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the emails; the FBI is planning to charge and arrest her with multiple federal crimes including conspiracy to entice minors and perjury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a question from a Deputy Director (DD) asking for an update on the status of the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: The document references the ongoing Epstein investigation in the context of planning Maxwell's arrest, implying their historical connection in the criminal case.

events.title: FBI Coordination Call on Maxwell Arrest
events.description: The FBI New York field office plans a conference call with SDNY to discuss moving up the arrest timeline for Ghislaine Maxwell from August to within the next few weeks.

events.title: Development of Charges Against Maxwell
events.description: FBI personnel list the federal charges likely to be brought against Ghislaine Maxwell, including conspiracy to entice minors, transportation of minors, and perjury.

events.title: Location Tracking of Maxwell
events.description: The FBI states they believe Maxwell is in Massachusetts, quarantining at a boyfriend's house, and have identified two possible mobile phones for her to track via GPS once an arrest warrant is obtained.

keyFacts: On June 22, 2020, the FBI was actively planning to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell and had moved the timeline up from August to 'within the next few weeks'.
The anticipated federal charges against Maxwell included conspiracy to entice minors, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of minors, and two counts of perjury.
Investigators believed Maxwell was located in Massachusetts, specifically quarantining at a boyfriend's house, and had identified two mobile phones to track via GPS upon obtaining an arrest warrant.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI New York and the Southern District of New York (SDNY) prosecutors regarding the arrest plan and investigation follow-up.
A question from a Deputy Director (DD) about the status of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation is noted, indicating the two cases were linked in the broader investigation.
